alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island Interior; Big Island North; Big Island Southeast; Big Island Summit; Kohala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 18 at 4:56AM HST until further notice by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR ALL HAWAIIAN ISLANDS... ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Maui, Molokai, Lanai, Kahoolawe, and the Big Island. * WHEN...From this evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flood prone roads and other low lying areas may be closed due to elevated runoff and overflowing streams. Urban areas may receive more significant flooding and property damage due to rapid runoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Tropical Storm Calvin will produce periods of heavy rainfall over all islands in Maui and Hawaii Counties starting this evening through Wednesday afternoon. Excessive rainfall may lead to flooding conditions and landslides over steep terrain, especially along east and southeast facing slopes.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
